business.headline: Muhurat Trading ends in green; Cipla, Bajaj Finserv among top gainersThe BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 both closed in the green, led by gains in Cipla and Bajaj Finserv, even as mid-session profit booking trimmed early advances.

Samvat 2082: Experts see new highs, bet on domestic sectorsFor investors, Bandyopadhyay recommends focusing on domestic growth stories. "Cement, infrastructure, construction, and capital goods will lead the charge," he noted, highlighting Ultratech Cement, L&T, and Bharti Airtel as top picks.

Muhurat Trading 2025: Sensex, Nifty dip after strong opening; Infosys up 1%The BSE Sensex rose 180.76 points, or 0.21%, to 84,544.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 62.60 points, or 0.24%, to 25,905.75 at 1:50 pm.
How to make the most of your Diwali bonus and build long-term wealthTurn your Diwali bonus into a stepping stone for long-term financial security with these expert-backed tips.

Gold hits Rs 1.30 lakh again, silver at Rs 1.58 lakh: Buy now or wait for a dip?Gold and silver are regaining momentum amid festive demand and global uncertainty. Investors should buy with discipline, stagger purchases, and treat bullion as a long-term hedge rather than chasing short-term spikes.

Muhurat Trading today: Your quick guide to today's one-hour special sessionAs Muhurat Trading 2025 begins this afternoon, optimism runs high on Dalal Street. With Nifty near record highs and liquidity improving, experts suggest discipline, stock selection, and long-term focus.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on Diwali as Reliance, bank stocks shineThe BSE Sensex rose 0.5% to 84,363.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 0.49% to 25,851—both hitting fresh one-year highs. Over the past four sessions, the indices have climbed 2.8%, leaving them less than 2% away from their all-time highs scaled in September 2024.

China files WTO complaint against India over EV subsidies and batteriesThe Chinese Commerce Ministry has alleged that the measures by India violate several WTO obligations, including the principle of national treatment, and constitute import substitution subsidies, which are explicitly prohibited under the multi-lateral trade rules.

Muhurat Trading on October 21: Check timing, trade strategy and moreMuhurat Trading will take place on October 21 this year. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm, and a closing session until 3:05 pm.

Reliance shares jump 3% after Q2 results. Should it be in your Diwali portfolio?Around 10:20 am, shares of Reliance Industries rose 3.22% to Rs 1,462.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock's sharp upmove added to the broader market rally on Dalal Street as sentiment turned upbeat following a string of solid earnings reports.

Diwali cheer on Dalal Street as Sensex jumps nearly 700 pointsAt around 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 673.90 points to 84,626.09, while the NSE Nifty50 surged 202.50 points to 25,912.35. Broader market indices also witnessed sharp gains, and volatility dropped, indicating strong investor confidence.

Silver prices fall after Diwali buying. Is it still a good bet?Silver has surged nearly 98% in a year, breaching Rs 2 lakh/kg in parts of India before a post-Diwali dip. But is investing in the precious metal still a good bet? With industrial demand booming and supply tightening, reports suggest silver's shine might just be getting started.

EU to hold urgent talks on European industries hit by China's rare earth curbsChina, the world's leading producer of the minerals used to make magnets crucial to the auto, electronics and defence industries, this month announced new controls on the export of rare-earth technologies.

PM's Diwali gift delivered: Nirmala Sitharaman presents GST 2.0 report cardGST Bachat Utsav: Sitharaman, addressing a press conference along with ministers Piyush Goyal and Ashwini Vaishnaw ahead of Diwali, said the GST rate cuts resulted in bumper sales of cars and electronics.

Gold prices near record high on Dhanteras: Should you buy?Gold prices have been on a relentless rally, hitting new record highs almost every day. But does this glittering streak make it the right fit for your investment portfolio this Dhanteras?

Gold flashing a big warning signal: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu says amid rising pricesAs gold prices soar globally, Zoho's Sridhar Vembu raises a red flag. Does the surge signal investor anxiety and eroding trust in the system or reveal a deeper economic fault line?

Gold prices hit record high ahead of Dhanteras, see Rs 3,200 hike in DelhiTraders said gold buying activity picked up sharply as stockists built fresh positions on expectations of higher sales during the festive season.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.
Sensex ends 484 points higher, Nifty above 25,700; Asian Paints jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 484.53 points higher at 83,952.19, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 124.55 points to close at 25,709.85.

entertainment.headline: How Thamma makes way for Shakti Shalini: Is Maddock bringing a modern-day Kali? 'Thamma' sets the stage for 'Shakti Shalini', Maddock Films' next horror-comedy that could mark the rise of a divine feminine force. With hints of Goddess Kali's mythology and a powerful new heroine at its core, 'Shakti Shalini' might just be the universe's most intriguing chapter yet.

Woke up to Delhi's AQI touching 447: Vaani Kapoor shares concern on toxic air As Delhi-NCR celebrates Diwali under Stage 2 of the Graded Response Action Plan, residents face severe air pollution, with the city's AQI reaching hazardous levels. Actor Vaani Kapoor, in Delhi for the festival with her family, highlighted the worsening air quality on Instagram.

Baseer, Nehal first couple of Bigg Boss 19? Farrhana thinks it's fake Baseer Ali and Nehal Chudasama's growing bond in 'Bigg Boss 19' has raised doubts among viewers and contestants alike. The latest promo shows Farrhana Bhatt questioning the genuineness of Baseer's feelings towards Nehal.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat review: Another obsessive lover in another problematic filmRelease Date:Tue Oct 21, 2025 Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat movie review: This film, starring Harshvardhan Rane and Sona Bajwa, depicts an obsessive lover's troubling pursuit. The film raises concerns about glamorising toxic relationships amid rising crimes against women.

I Play Rocky: Anthony Ippolito's first look as Sylvester Stallone unveiled Amazon MGM released first look of Anthony Ippolito portraying young Sylvester Stallone in 'I Play Rocky'. The film explores Stallone's journey before global fame, highlighting his unshakeable belief in becoming Rocky Balboa.

Ajay Devgn, Madhur Bhandarkar to Adnan Sami: Film industry mourns Asrani's death The death of veteran actor Asrani has come as a huge loss to his fans and the Indian film industry alike. Actor Ajay Devgn, director Madhur Bhandarkar, singer Adnan Sami, among others, remembered the Sholay actor and shared their condolences.

Would You Marry Me review: Jung So-min, Choi Woo-shik make predictability look goodRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 'Would You Marry Me' is a light-hearted K-drama starring Jung So-min and Choi Woo-shik that combines revenge, romance, and comedy with charm and sincerity. Despite its familiar tropes of fake marriage and second chances, the show's sharp humour, performances, and self-aware writing make it engaging.

Yash, Allu Arjun to Trisha: Here's how South Indian stars celebrated Diwali 2025 As Diwali 2025 flares up across the country, South Indian stars like Yash, Allu Arjun, Trisha and Varun Tej shared glimpses from their celebrations with friends and family on social media.

Why Asrani wanted to keep his funeral private, away from the spotlight Veteran actor Govardhan Asrani passed away quietly at 84 after a brief hospitalisation. His family respected his wish for a private farewell, sparking reflection on his remarkable cinematic legacy.

Beyond comedy: How Abhiman revealed Asrani's soulful side Asrani, known for his comic genius, gave a soulful performance in Abhiman. His role as Chandar Kripalani showcased his emotional depth beyond comedy and left a lasting impact.

South cinema's Diwali box office battle: Which star sparkles brightest this year? This Diwali saw six films from Tamil and Telugu cinema featuring next-gen stars hit theatres. 'Dude' emerged as the clear box office winner, nearing Rs 100 crore worldwide, signalling a promising trend for youthful cinema.

Ranbir-Alia's Diwali had love, light and Raha's hand-painted diyas. Pics Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor celebrated a cozy, intimate Diwali with family and close friends. From daughter Raha painting diyas to Alia's elegant festive look, the celebration radiated warmth and togetherness.

TXT's Yeonjun announces his first solo album NO LABELS: Part 1 Yeonjun of TXT is set to release his first solo album NO LABELS: Part 1 on November 7, 2025. The album marks a new phase in his career, highlighting artistic freedom and fresh collaborations.

Ayan Mukerji quits Dhoom 4, shifts focus to Brahmastra sequel: Report Director Ayan Mukerji reportedly left 'Dhoom 4' after his vision did not match the film's creative direction. Yash Raj Films is now likely to consider new talent for the directorial role and main cast.

Pavitra Punia finds love again, celebrates Diwali in US Actor Pavitra Punia has confirmed she is in a new relationship with a US-based businessman and is set to celebrate Diwali with his family. Punia expressed mixed emotions about celebrating away from her own family for the first time.

Jennifer Aniston says actor-father dissuaded her from films, snubs nepotism talk Jennifer Aniston says her father, actor John Aniston, told her to "get a real job" rather than pursue acting. The 'Friends' star has also addressed the nepotism debate.

Vash Level 2 OTT release: When and where to watch Janki Bodiwala's supernatural horror film 'Vash Level 2', the Gujarati supernatural psychological horror sequel, is set to release on Netflix on October 22 in both Gujarati and Hindi.

Naga Chaitanya-Sobhita's first Diwali together is all about love and light Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala celebrated their first Diwali as a married couple with intimate, colourful festivities at home. Their Hyderabad wedding was a grand affair, and both stars are now busy with exciting new projects.

Aamir Khan mourns Asrani's death: A timeless artist, remembered always Actor Aamir Khan on Tuesday condoled the death of veteran actor Govardhan Asrani on social media. Asrani, aged 84, died following a prolonged illness and was recently hospitalised.

general news.headline: Ties with India independent: Afghanistan slams Pak's 'illogical' proxy war claimsAfghanistan's Defense Minister Mawlawi Mohammad Yaqoob Mujahid dismissed Pakistan's claims blaming India for tensions in the region as "unfounded, illogical, and unacceptable."

Death of Punjab ex-DGP's son gets more intriguing as second video emergesPolice have registered a case against former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa, his wife, and family members after their late son alleged abuse and a murder conspiracy in a pre-recorded video. In another video that has surfaced, the son gave a clean chit to his family, dismissing his earlier allegations as a figment of his imagination caused by schizophrenia.

India's Diwali fireworks set off alarm in PakistanAs Diwali fireworks lit up skies across India, toxic air and pollutants drifted across the border into Pakistan. Lahore's air quality plunged to alarming levels, trailing only Delhi as the most-polluted city in the world. Pakistan's Punjab government has blamed cross-border pollution for worsening the existing smog crisis.

US clarifies on H-1B visa fee, big relief for students, techiesThe Donald Trump administration has clarified the exemptions to the controversial $100,000 H-1B visa fee introduced via a presidential proclamation in September. Employers can now proceed with change-of-status filings. The proclamation's scope is limited to new petitions for individuals outside the country.

Not just fake paneer, India has an egg problem as wellIndia has an egg problem. It is also a problem that mirrors our problem of low-quality and adulterated food, particularly on quick commerce apps where prices are high and yet quality is missing.

BCCI warns Mohsin Naqvi of escalation to ICC if Asia Cup not handed to IndiaThe BCCI have written an official email to ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi to hand over the Asia Cup title to the champions India immediately. The Indian team refused to collect the trophy after the final win against Pakistan from Naqvi, prompting him to tell the ACC officials to take it away.

Damage control? Kiran Shaw, DK Shivakumar meet amid Bengaluru infra criticism rowKiran Mazumdar-Shaw met Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar at his residence. Sources said they discussed her criticism of Bengaluru's poor roads and garbage issues. Shivakumar reportedly assured her that the grievances would be addressed promptly

Revealing wedding dress of daughter of Iran's hijab enforcer sparks outrageThe video shows Ali Shamkhani – the senior adviser to the Iranian Supreme Leader – walking his daughter down the aisle. The bride is seen wearing a strapless white dress with a low neckline.

Beyond comedy: Asrani's soulful streak in AbhimanAsrani, known for his comic genius, gave a soulful performance in Abhiman. His role as Chandar Kripalani showcased his emotional depth beyond comedy and left a lasting impact.

Born in New Zealand, facing deportation to India: Punished for parents' past?An 18-year-old, born and raised in Auckland to Indian parents who were undocumented immigrants, is now facing deportation after his residency bid was denied. Having never attended school or left New Zealand, Navjot Singh fears for his survival in India, where he has no support. Community leaders and politicians have condemned the decision.

A 5-day national holiday? Why India can have a long leave around DiwaliIndia celebrates together, yet it doesn't. Countries across the world pause for week-long holidays, but India's fragmented festival calendar does not allow a national breather. Diwali might be the one festival that could be our chance to pause, recharge, and celebrate together.

BJP claims AAP forcing Punjab farmers to burn stubble amid Delhi pollutionDelhi Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa launched a sharp attack on the Aam Aadmi Party, accusing it of deliberately making Punjab farmers burn stubble to worsen Delhi's pollution and defame Diwali.

How Thamma makes way for Shakti Shalini: Is Maddock bringing a modern-day Kali?'Thamma' sets the stage for 'Shakti Shalini', Maddock Films' next horror-comedy that could mark the rise of a divine feminine force. With hints of Goddess Kali's mythology and a powerful new heroine at its core, 'Shakti Shalini' might just be the universe's most intriguing chapter yet.

Delhi's Diwali defiance: Why firecrackers persist despite the smogDelhi wakes up each Diwali to prayers for light amid clouds of smoke. Despite bans and 'green' reforms, fireworks still rule the night, exposing governance gaps and collective complicity in pollution. To breathe better, Delhi needs to reimagine Diwali.

Short expects Hazlewood, Starc to exploit Kohli's off stump weakness in AdelaideAustralia batter Matthew Short admitted he did not attend the fast bowlers' meetings but expects the veteran pacers to once again look to exploit Virat Kohli's weakness outside off stump when India take on Australia in the second ODI at the Adelaide Oval on Thursday.

Lokpal orders 7 BMW cars worth Rs 5 crore, sparks outrageLokpal's move to purchase seven BMW cars worth Rs 5 crore has sparked outrage with Opposition leaders asking the anti-corruption watchdog to rather opt for an Indian manufacturer like Mahindra.

Your mom did: Karoline Leavitt snaps at reporter over question on Trump-Putin meetWhite House press secretary Karoline Leavitt criticised a Huffington Post reporter during a heated exchange over the Trump-Putin summit location.

Punjab Police foil terror plot, arrest 2, seize rocket-propelled grenadePunjab Police foiled a terror plot in Amritsar, arresting two operatives linked to Pakistan's ISI and seizing a rocket-propelled grenade intended for a targeted attack. Further investigation is underway to dismantle the network.

Send video to Rail Minister, I don't care: Woman screams at TTE during ticket disputeThe woman, who claimed to be a loco pilot's wife, became aggressive and told the TTE to record a video for the Railway Minister, insisting she was not afraid.

Germany's pet parking pads are going viral. Is India ready to follow?Germany's pet parking pads are going viral and making pet lovers proud, but the big question is, could something like this actually work in India, too?

Vijay Deverakonda's Diwali post has fans convinced Rashmika Mandanna was thereVijay Deverakonda's Diwali celebration videos have fans convinced Rashmika Mandanna was present. The couple's engagement rumours and possible February wedding add excitement to the speculation.

Too many Diwali sweets and no clue what to do? Shake them into cocktailsAcross India's best bars and kitchens, chefs and mixologists are reimagining mithai as liquid inspiration. From Gulab Jamun Old Fashioneds to Kulfi Negronis, these drinks are sweet, nostalgic, and surprisingly sophisticated, if you do them right.

Supreme Court prioritised right to burn crackers over right to live: Amitabh KantFormer CEO of the Centre's think tank NITI Aayog Amitabh Kant's strong observations came as Delhi woke up to a thick layer of poisonous air after a night of heavy firecracker burning. At the time of writing, the AQI in Delhi-NCR stood at 351, placing it in the 'very poor' category.

Would You Marry Me review: Jung So-min, Choi Woo-shik make predictability look goodRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025'Would You Marry Me' is a light-hearted K-drama starring Jung So-min and Choi Woo-shik that combines revenge, romance, and comedy with charm and sincerity. Despite its familiar tropes of fake marriage and second chances, the show's sharp humour, performances, and self-aware writing make it engaging.
Varun Dhawan shares Diwali picture with daughter Lara, deletes it laterActor Varun Dhawan shared a heartfelt Diwali photo with his daughter Lara on Instagram. The post was deleted soon after.

How Thamma makes way for Shakti Shalini: Is Maddock bringing a modern-day Kali?'Thamma' sets the stage for 'Shakti Shalini', Maddock Films' next horror-comedy that could mark the rise of a divine feminine force. With hints of Goddess Kali's mythology and a powerful new heroine at its core, 'Shakti Shalini' might just be the universe's most intriguing chapter yet.

sports.headline: Older and wiser, Steve Smith prioritises mental freshness for Ashes 2025 Smith reflects on career adjustments and mental strategies as he prepares to captain Australia in the Ashes opener, emphasising the importance of prioritisation and mental well-being.

Sturdy Stubbs keeps South Africa in game after Maharaj heroics Pakistan vs South Africa, 2nd Test Day 2: Tristan Stubbs came up with a resolute knock to help South Africa cut down on the lead in the first innings. Earlier, Keshav Maharaj took seven wickets to trigger a massive Pakistan collapse.

Short expects Hazlewood, Starc to exploit Kohli's off stump weakness in Adelaide Australia batter Matthew Short admitted he did not attend the fast bowlers' meetings but expects the veteran pacers to once again look to exploit Virat Kohli's weakness outside off stump when India take on Australia in the second ODI at the Adelaide Oval on Thursday.

Smriti Mandhana tops Women's ODI batters list, Deepti Sharma 3rd in bowlers charts Smriti Mandhana has widened her margin atop the ICC Women's ODI Batter Rankings following a series of strong displays at the World Cup. Key changes also see Deepti Sharma, Alyssa Healy and several others achieve new career highs.

Bayern Munich extend manager Vincent Kompany's contract till 2029 Bayern Munich have extended head coach Vincent Kompany's contract by two years, keeping him at the club until 2029. The decision comes after Kompany led Bayern to the Bundesliga title in his debut season.

Keshav Maharaj scripts history with 7-wicket haul in Rawalpindi Test Pakistan vs South Africa, 2nd Test: Keshav Maharaj became the first visiting spinner to take seven wickets in an innings in Rawalpindi. The left-arm spinner triggered Pakistan's dramatic collapse on Tuesday morning.

Spin storm in Dhaka: West Indies bowl full 50 overs of spin in historic feat West Indies made history by bowling only spin in their entire 50 overs in the 2nd ODI against Bangladesh in Dhaka. This bold strategy restricted Bangladesh to 213 for 7 and showcased the effectiveness of spin bowling on a slow, turning pitch.

Rizwan was not a bad ODI captain: Amir slams Pakistan board over captaincy saga Former pacer Mohammad Amir has criticised the Pakistan Cricket Board's decision to sack Mohammad Rizwan as ODI captain and hand the reins to left-arm pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, a move that has raised eyebrows across cricketing circles.

Klopp hints Liverpool return is possible but backs Slot to turn things around Jurgen Klopp says a return to Liverpool is 'theoretically possible' but rules out managing any other English club. He voices full confidence in Arne Slot as Liverpool face a challenging spell, having lost four matches in a row for the first time since 2014.

Trophy War Erupts: BCCI Threatens ICC Action as Pak Chief Refuses to Return Asia Cup! This special report focuses on the escalating dispute over the Asia Cup trophy between the BCCI and ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi. After winning the tournament, the Indian team refused to accept the trophy from Naqvi, who is also the PCB chairman, in protest of the Pahalgam terror attack. BCCI Secretary Devjit Saikia stated, 'we have written to the ACC to give us the trophy to the champion team and we are awaiting a response. If there will be no response or negative response, then we will write to the ICC.' The trophy is now reportedly locked in the ACC's Dubai office, with the BCCI formally demanding its return and preparing to escalate the matter to the International Cricket Council if the standoff continues.

Spin storm in Dhaka: West Indies bowl full 50 overs of spin in historic feat West Indies made history by bowling only spin in their entire 50 overs in the 2nd ODI against Bangladesh in Dhaka. This bold strategy restricted Bangladesh to 213 for 7 and showcased the effectiveness of spin bowling on a slow, turning pitch.

Rizwan was not a bad ODI captain: Amir slams Pakistan board over captaincy saga Former pacer Mohammad Amir has criticised the Pakistan Cricket Board's decision to sack Mohammad Rizwan as ODI captain and hand the reins to left-arm pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, a move that has raised eyebrows across cricketing circles.

He voices full confidence in Arne Slot as Liverpool face a challenging spell, having lost four matches in a row for the first time since 2014.

After winning the tournament, the Indian team refused to accept the trophy from Naqvi, who is also the PCB chairman, in protest of the Pahalgam terror attack. BCCI Secretary Devjit Saikia stated, 'we have written to the ACC to give us the trophy to the champion team and we are awaiting a response. If there will be no response or negative response, then we will write to the ICC.' The trophy is now reportedly locked in the ACC's Dubai office, with the BCCI formally demanding its return and preparing to escalate the matter to the International Cricket Council if the standoff continues.

Perth setback behind, Virat Kohli looks million dollars in Adelaide netsVirat Kohli trained hard in the Adelaide nets ahead of the team's second ODI against Australia. The batter looked a million bucks as the sound of the ball striking his bat reverberated in the arena.

Australia suffer captain Alyssa Healy blow before business endAustralia will be without their captain Alyssa Healy for their crucial top-of-the-table clash against England in Indore on Wednesday. Australia will be hoping to have their skipper back before the business end of the tournament.

Where is Sarfaraz Khan? Batter's absence from India A squad baffles fansThe BCCI announced India A's squad against South Africa for the upcoming series in November. Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan did not make it to the squad, baffling fans.

BCCI warns Mohsin Naqvi of escalation to ICC if Asia Cup not handed to IndiaThe BCCI have written an official email to ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi to hand over the Asia Cup title to the champions India immediately. The Indian team refused to collect the trophy after the final win against Pakistan from Naqvi, prompting him to tell the ACC officials to take it away.

Watch: Ronaldo-less Al Nassr arrive in Goa ahead of AFC Champions League 2 clashThe Al Nassr squad, minus Cristiano Ronaldo, arrived in Goa ahead of their AFC Champions League 2 clash against FC Goa on Tuesday, October 21. Ronaldo is yet to take part in the AFC Champions League 2 so far.

Babar Azam in crisis? Pakistan coach reflects on batter's lean patch in TestsPakistan team management is confident Babar Azam will be able to score big, sooner than latter. Babar has endured a prolonged lean patch, failing in the second innings of the ongoing Test against South Africa in Rawalpindi.

Ro-Ko legacy will remain regardless of when they retire from game: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri said that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's legacy will always remain irrespective of when they decide to retire from the game. Kohli and Rohit's future has been a question of debate with the 2027 ODI World Cup on the horizon.

BCCI warns Mohsin Naqvi of escalation to ICC if Asia Cup not handed to IndiaThe BCCI have written an official email to ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi to hand over the Asia Cup title to the champions India immediately. The Indian team refused to collect the trophy after the final win against Pakistan from Naqvi, prompting him to tell the ACC officials to take it away.

Watch: Ronaldo-less Al Nassr arrive in Goa ahead of AFC Champions League 2 clashThe Al Nassr squad, minus Cristiano Ronaldo, arrived in Goa ahead of their AFC Champions League 2 clash against FC Goa on Tuesday, October 21. Ronaldo is yet to take part in the AFC Champions League 2 so far.

Babar has endured a prolonged lean patch, failing in the second innings of the ongoing Test against South Africa in Rawalpindi.

Ro-Ko legacy will remain regardless of when they retire from game: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri said that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's legacy will always remain irrespective of when they decide to retire from the game. Kohli and Rohit's future has been a question of debate with the 2027 ODI World Cup on the horizon.

Pant back, to captain India A in four-day matches before South Africa TestsRishabh Pant will captain India A in two four-day matches against South Africa A before a Test series against the Proteas in November. Test specialists, including KL Rahul, Mohammed Siraj and Dhruv Jurel, will feature in the second four-day match, which will be played at BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru.

Demons of BGT 2024-25 still haunting Virat Kohli: Irfan PathanIndia vs Australia: Both Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma failed in their return to international cricket. After the 1st ODI, former cricketer Irfan Pathan stated the obvious - the demons of BGT are still haunting the senior duo.

Don't write off champions: Aussie great backs Kohli, Rohit for 2027 World CupIndia tour of Australia: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has backed both Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to feature in the 2027 World Cup. The legendary batters endured a disappointing return to international cricket as India's batting line-up collapsed in the series opener in Perth on Sunday, 19 October.

The key piece of advice that changed Labuschagne's fortunes ahead of AshesMarnus Labuschagne has made a compelling case for a Test recall, hitting 4 hundreds in his last 5 Sheffield Shield games. What led to this sudden change in form after a prolonged lean patch in Test cricket?

IND vs AUS: For how long can Kuldeep Yadav put on a brave face?Spinner Kuldeep Yadav was not picked in the playing XI for the team's first ODI against Australia. Kuldeep, despite being carried for the majority of the series, has not been the preferred choice of the Gambhir management.

India travel to Adelaide on Diwali, fans shower love with Rohit-Kohli chantsIndian cricket fans created a festive scene at Adelaide airport, singing chants for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli as the team arrived ahead of the second ODI. The team, led by Shubman Gill, looks to recover from their loss in Perth.

Season of light and the problem of 80 per cent commitmentAs the country celebrates Diwali, there will be no gala dinner for India's women's team — only a search for fire and belief ahead of their clash with New Zealand.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
